description:
The second season of Diabolik Lovers.

Komori Yui is still adapting to the life of living with the sadistic Sakamaki vampire brothers, how will her relationship fare between them throughout the rest of her time in high school?

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

title.native: DIABOLIK LOVERS MORE,BLOOD アンソロジー

node.description:
[Blog](http://daisukeiwasaki.blog22.fc2.com/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/Iwasaki_Rejet) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/id_rejet/) | [Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%A9%E5%B4%8E%E5%A4%A7%E4%BB%8B)

The managing director of otome company Rejet.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tekitounisatoi)

Satoi is a Japanese illustrator. She is the co-founder of Poni-Pachet alongside [Yumas](https://anilist.co/staff/286812/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ogura_koubou)

In 1977, Ogura joined *Kobayashi Production* and learned the ropes of art direction under [Shichirou Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/103964/Shichirou-Kobayashi). In 1983 he left and established Studio Fuga together with Kouji Oono and [Toshiharu Mizutani](https://anilist.co/staff/121908/Toshiharu-Mizutani). There he eventually left as well and formed his own 'Ogura Kobo' at Production I.G., where he trains newer art directors. He continues to be a major presence at Production I.G. as one of their most prominent art directors.

Ogura's style is, similar to Kobayashi's, rooted in imposing architecture, ambient colors, and Western perspectives versus traditional Japanese isometric perspectives. Ogura's backgrounds are usually urban in setting and has a less saturated color palette, and uses more cool than warm colors. Ogura's fantastical, European Kobayashi influence is easily seen in [Wings of Honneamise](https://anilist.co/anime/1034/Ouritsu-Uchuugun-Honneamise-no-Tsubasa/), and his later work has remained distinctly metropolitan, something that can be seen even in the rural [FLCL](https://anilist.co/anime/227/FLCL/).
Mori Kaneko is a Japanese sound work manager.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/151217/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ryouhey_Drunk) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCP-evNobN1MJ61xHb8tAhcg)

Won Best Supporting Actor at the 6th Annual Seiyuu Awards for his performance as Kodaka Hasegawa in _Boku wa Tomodachi ga Sukunai_. Also part of the trio Trignal with fellow seiyuu [Takuya Eguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/102695/Eguchi-Takuya) and [Tsubasa Yonaga](https://anilist.co/staff/95556), and a host of the Kiramune label's radio programs.

Non-Anime Roles:


~!
• Childe (Genshin Impact)
• Hyde Kido (Under Night In-Birth)
• Touri Wataru (Hanaemu Kare to & bloom)!~

__Alma Mater:__ Toyo University

__[Website](https://www.yukihayashi.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayayu1231)__

__Introduction:__
Yuuki Hayashi is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor, who used to be a rhythmic gymnast

__Biography:__
His history in music began in university when he started creating music pieces for rhythmic gymnasts as a hobby for 5000 yen a piece. When he started getting requests from other universities for his music, his interest in music producing grew. After graduation, he was taught music for 6 months by a rhythmic gymnastics music producer, and now, he handles music for various sports. He also arranges music for dance, athletic competitions, companies, independent movies and recently, TV dramas and anime.

(Source: MyAnimeList, edited)

[Website](https://music.mages.co.jp/mikoto/index.html) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/mikoto-ryosuke/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/MIKOTO-Ryosuke-426929194116397/)

MIKOTO is a Japanese solo project of singer-songwriter, guitarist and lyricist Ryousuke.

Formerly a music composition unit made up of three members, MIKOTO became a solo endeavor in 2014 after the departure of MEG.ME and Shin'ya.

__Alma Mater:__ Toyo University

__[Website](https://www.yukihayashi.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayayu1231)__

__Introduction:__
Yuuki Hayashi is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor, who used to be a rhythmic gymnast

__Biography:__
His history in music began in university when he started creating music pieces for rhythmic gymnasts as a hobby for 5000 yen a piece. When he started getting requests from other universities for his music, his interest in music producing grew. After graduation, he was taught music for 6 months by a rhythmic gymnastics music producer, and now, he handles music for various sports. He also arranges music for dance, athletic competitions, companies, independent movies and recently, TV dramas and anime.

(Source: MyAnimeList, edited)
**Yuuji Hamasaki** is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger and guitarist, affiliated with [High Kick Entertainment](http://www.highkick.jp/).

John Ledford is an entrepreneur and leader in the North American anime industry. In 1992, he founded A.D. Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. With ADV's success, Ledford turned his sights to making the imaginative world of anime even more accessible with Anime Network's founding, North America’s first cable TV network dedicated to anime. He later partnered with Kadokawa Publishing and began Newtype USA with translated Japanese content and exclusive U.S. material related to all things anime, manga, and model reviews. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.
